intro: Tabernaemontana siphilitica, commonly known as the red-flowered star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant features strap-like, narrow leaves that are dark green and glossy. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of pink to red flowers that resemble stars, making it a popular ornamental plant. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, thriving in warm, Mediterranean climates.
